text: now that we've installed and configured
the CLI let's create a new react
application and then initialize a new
amplify project within the react
application
to do so we'll use create react out to
create a new react application called my
amplifier
once the new react application has been
created let's change into the new
directory
from within the new directory will run
amplifon it to initialize a new amplify
project will then be prompted for a few
options for the default editor I'll
choose Visual Studio code for the type
of app we're building we can choose
JavaScript for the framework we're using
we can choose react the source directory
can be left as source the distribution
directory build the build command can be
left as build
and the start command from me let this
start
next we're given the option to choose an
AWS profile here we can choose the
profile that we created when we
configured the CLI
now our amplifier project has been
initialized we should now see a dot
amplify our C file as well as an
amplifier in our root directory
the last thing we need to do is install
the AWS amplify and AWS amplify react
client libraries into our react
application
to do so we can either use NPM or yarn
to add AWS amplify and AWS amplify react
now the react app has been configured in
the amplify project has been created and
we're ready to begin adding new features
